Terminology: Kvalis is inhabited by the Kvalisian people, who are called Kvali.

Future

General

Due in part to a treacherous defeat at the hands of the Vaalorians and the dismantling of their empire, the Kvali are a disheartened people. Unlike the Vaalorians who retreated to the treetops, the Kvali retreated downward into old caves which were easily fortified and had a generous supply of fresh water. They survive on fungus and cave fish and rarely venture to the surface except in times of dire need and rarely consider the possibility of returning to the surface one day. Many have walled off the cave exits leaving themselves no choice but to live on in the caves as their sole existence.

Economy

Due to the treacherous nature of ground travel there is very little commerce outside the small remaining communities.


Architecture Styles

Most of the Kvalis live in underground caves with few or no remaining entrances to the surface. Some luminescent fungi provide a small amount of light and are cultivated below ground as an efficient means of artificial light and a food source as well.

Races

Information regarding predominant races or dispersal of races throughout.


Past

General

The Kvalis are the settled descendants of the nomadic tribes that once roamed much of of the continent. They are a highly religious society worshiping a variety of gods in their complex mythology. Though their population has settled they maintain many of their customs including sparse clothing made from animal skins that have been dyed in many colors, and a fierce distrust of outsiders. While they do engage in a fair amount of trade, they prefer to frequent the market places of others rather than engage in commerce with them in their own lands which they fiercely defend.

Economy

One of the odd features of the Kvalis is that their market places are only open to residents of the area. They travel to other markets outside their borders to barter and trade for other goods, often with large caravans of heavily defended merchandise. Their primary exports are dyes and cloth goods such as backpacks, belts, and many other items. Their leather workers are highly regarded and their merchandise some of the best in the world. They are also renowned for their ranged light weaponry including longbows and crossbows made from the wood of a rare variety of tree that grows only sparingly along their shorelines.


Architecture Styles

Key features of the Kvalis architecture include large stepped pyramids and other large structures. The more traditional style structures sport high narrow archways and flying buttresses for additional support. They have also built some exceptionally large arenas where many practice and train in their ancestral styles of warfare.
